byline.original: By MARY WILLIAMS WALSH and MICHAEL CORKERY

abstract: Economists enlisted by group of hedge funds and other companies that have invested heavily in Puerto Rican bonds say debt crisis can be solved by increasing tax collection and securing additional financing; analysis conflicts with Puerto Rico Gov Alejandro Garcia Padilla's assertion that it cannot pay its debts and needs moratorium on bond payments.
lead_paragraph: Economists working for firms with investments in Puerto Rican bonds said Sunday night that stepping up tax collections and obtaining additional financing could help solve the territory’s debt crisis.

headline.main: Puerto Rico Should Collect Unpaid Taxes, Hedge Fund-Backed Economists Say
headline.print_headline: Hedge Fund Economists See Solution to Island’s Debt Crisis

snippet: Economists working for firms with investments in Puerto Rican bonds said Sunday night that stepping up tax collections and obtaining additional financing could help solve the territory’s debt crisis.
